Video Tutorial

APIs can be very useful for different situations but they can also be difficult to program, so in today’s article I am going to show you how to create a simple API with the help of google spreadsheets.

In this tutorial we are going to use our api to create a web application.

Prerequisites

  • A Google account.

Setting up the spreadsheet

The first thing we need to do is create a spreadsheet in sheets.new .Next click on the tools menu and then click on the script editor button as shown in the picture.

Creating the web application server

To collect data, we need to be able to capture the GET or POST request sent by the data source.You can use the code I show below to start using the api.


function doGet(e) {
  
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("This is an example GET post!");
}

function doPost(e) {
    var sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSheet();
    
   
    var body = JSON.parse(e.postData.contents)

    sheet.appendRow([body.id,
    body.date_created,
    body.first_name,
    body.email,
    ])
}

Publishing the web application

For our web app to be visible we must publish it, to publish it we must go to the publish menu and then click on the button deploy as web app.Then in the menu click on make the web visible to everyone, even anonymous.

Now you can visit the url that resulted and you will see the following message means that all is working: This is an example GET post!

Testing the functions

To test if our system works you can go to this page reqbin.com to send a post request.You can use the following json code to make the post request:


{
    "id": 1,
    "date_created": "24-11-2020 10:10 PM",
    "name": "Example",
    "email": "test@example.com"
}

Once the post request is sent, you can see that the data has been sent to the spreadsheet.

Notion is a tool that allows us to create blogs where we can add links, text pages, images, among other options.

One of its features is the embed function that allows us to insert a url on our page, which gives us the option to insert widgets.

In this post we show you a compilation of the best widgets for notion and we also show you how to include them on your page.

Featured widgets

Weather widget: Weather widget allows us to include the weather summary in our blog in notion in a very simple way. Link

Analytics: This widget allows us to insert the google analytics tag in our workspace. Link

Mail form: This widget allows us to create an email list in a very simple way. Link

Interactive comments: This widget allows us to create a comment section.Link

Indify: This website allows us to create our own custom widgets.Link

Spotify: This widget allows us to index a playlist, a song or an artist to our page. Link

Chilipepper:This page allows us to create a contact form for our workspace. Link

How to install a widget on notion

To install a widget in notion we have to click on the + button or write / then we have to search the embeed list and then put the url that will have given us the widget

Github is an essential tool for developers that allows us to upload our code to collaborate with other people and we can take advantage of the potential of discord to receive notifications from a repository on a discord channel.

To start we need a github account and a discord account and server. Next we will create a text channel and name it whatever we want.Now we go to the configuration of the channel that we just created and we click where it says integrations and we create one.

To continue we must copy the url of the webhook and go to the github repository that we want to connect and we go to configuration, once there, we have to go to webhooks and create a new one.

Now we paste our url and add /github to the end. We select application / json and below we select the option of send me everyting.

Now we can test by staring our repository that the notification reaches the discord channel.

This is it, I hope this tutorial has helped you

Github gives us the option to create a special repository to appear at the top of our profile. I’m going to teach you how to create it and I’m going to give you ideas and tools to personalize it.

Creating the repository

To begin we must go to our profile and create a new repository, and we must name the repository the same as our user.As you can see, we will get a notice that we have found a special repository.

Once the repository is created add a readme.md file and add a small test text.Now you will see that it appears at the top of your profile.

Customizing the repository

The markdown language is used in your readme, so I recommend that you visit () to find out more about markdown if you don’t have any knowledge yet.

Tools you can use:

  • Shields.io: This page allows us to create buttons for our repository.
  • Metrics.lecoq.io: This page allows us to generate statistics of our account on github.
  • Streaks: With this script we can show the streaks of contributions. To use it you must change the part of the url where it says user=

https://github-readme-streak-stats.herokuapp.com/?user=daniellop1

In this article I am going to teach you how to create a theme for visual studio code in a simple way. Let's take my theme, colored, as a reference.

Initial requirements

-Node.js installed

-Git installed

Installation of necessary packages

To start with the process of creating the extension we have to install this package called yo (Yeoman).

To install it we will execute the following command in the terminal:


npm install -g yo generator-code

Once installed we will write the following command to execute the cli: 


yo code

This command will launch the following panel in which we will select the New color Theme option.

Then we will follow the following steps:

  1. Select No, start fresh
  2. Enter the name of your extension
  3. Enter your extension identifier (ex. of what a identifier is: {publisher-name}.{identifier} | just press enter and use the default)
  4. Write a short description of what the theme represents or what the idea behind the theme is.
  5. Enter the name (case sensitive) as you want it to appear in the marketplace (This is the extension display name)
  6. Select a base theme to be used as a starting point

Once all this is done we will have successfully created our project.

In order to customize the theme we have to modify the values of the .json file inside the theme folder that will have been generated. For further guidance on this please refer to the following links “Extension help” and “How to theme the editor”.

Publishing the theme

To continue we need to install another package using npm: 


npm install vsce -g

Next you must create a repository, preferably on Github to avoid errors.

It is important that you verify that the package.json data is correct and you should also check that you have at least the following variables.


{
    "name": "colored",
    "displayName": "Colored",
    "description": "Color theme for developers",
    "version": "0.0.3",
    "publisher": "Daniellop",
    "icon": "logo.png",
    "repository": "Daniellop1/colored",
    "engines": {
        "vscode": "^1.52.0"
    },
    "categories": [
        "Themes"
    ],
    "contributes": {
        "themes": [
            {
                "label": "Colored",
                "uiTheme": "vs",
                "path": "./themes/Colored-color-theme.json"
            }
        ]
    }
}

It is very important that you specify a logo and the name of the publisher.

To publish our extension we have to go to Azure DevOps and create an organization.

Once our organization is created we have to click on our profile and click on the option Personal access tokens as shown in the image

Now we have to create a new token and give it all the permissions.

Now we will execute the following command to create a new publisher:


vsce create-publisher (publisher name)

Then we have to log in with the publisher that we just created and with the token with this command:


vsce login (publisher name)

Now we create the package with the following command and publish it with the second command:


vsce package


vsce publish

Ready!. Its extension will be published. You must change the README.md file as it will be displayed on the extension page.

What is Gatsby?

Gatsby is a free and open source framework based on React that allows you to quickly develop websites and fast web applications.

Why Gatsby?

The future of the web is mobile, Javascript and APIs. Gatsby wants to be the universal JavaScript framework that has the vision that the whole “website is a web application and every web application is a website”. In addition, Gatsby.js is a static PWA generator, which thanks to its native operation, allows optimal loading and very fast navigation.

Configure Gatsby.js

You can install gastby on your computer using the command bellow:

npm install -g gatsby

You can create your first project in Gatsby.js using the Gatsby CLI:

gatsby new itdo-gatsby

I recommend using yarn as a package manager but you can use npm if you prefer

Bootstrap

Gatsby allows you to design a web page from scratch but, in order to simplify this introduction, we will use Bootstrap and its Sass version (SCSS). To do it you only have to execute inside the project, in your terminal:

yarn add bootstrap-scss

Since Gatsby doesn't understand SCSS files, you need to add some plugin that compiles your SCSS files. In this case we will use the Gatsby plugin "gatsby-plugin-sass".

yarn add gatsby-plugin-sass

How to see the result?

If you want, you can see the status of your project live by executing the following command in the terminal to start a development server:

gatsby develop

Now you can see the result at  http://localhost:8000

My history with browsers

I am a user of the mac operating system and I have been changing browsers continuously to see which one suited my needs.

First I started with chrome because it seemed the most appropriate for a person who was just starting in the world of technology and little by little I realized that there were other alternatives that offered more advantages than chrome. After chrome I made the jump to opera and I really liked its sidebar tools since it seemed very functional and very practical but I also realized that it was not the browser that I needed. After the operation I started using the default browser of the Mac (finder) and I spent a long time using it because it makes good use of the resources of the computer, it has good security and it is minimalist but in the end I got tired and wanted to jump to a better browser.

My current choice

I am currently using Naver Whale and I am very happy with my decision as it has all the features that I look for in a browser:

  • It has a simple interface
  • It has many options
  • Has a utility bar
  • It consumes very little battery and makes good use of resources
  • It has a simple and beautiful interface

Conclusion

If you are not sure which browser to choose, I would recommend that you try as many as possible until you find one that suits your needs.If you don't have the time and you want to play it safe, you can use Chrome or Whale as these are my main recommendations.

All browsers have their advantages and disadvantages but you have to find the one that best suits you.

These are my recommendations, I hope they help you choose :)

Today I'm going to talk to you about a way to publish and host your code for free and easy.

Github

Github is a platform that I think all developers have used at some point. Github allows us to upload our code, collaborate with our team and most importantly: publish our code through github pages.

Heroku

Heroku is a free salesforce platform that allows us to host and deploy our web applications and services. Its use is very simple and without a doubt it is a good option if you don't want to spend a lot of money and have a good service.

Netlify

Netlify is a platform that allows us to publish static sites from github or gitlab, it is easy to use and has many options. It has a free plan that seems more than enough if we are starting.

Vercel

Vercel is the competence of netlify and allows us to do the same, it has a better interface and integrates very well with next.js, its own javascript framework.

Conclution

You should find the platform that best meets your needs and try it.

When I was starting this was a big question for me and based on testing I have found the font that I like the most, so in this article I am going to show you my favourite programming fonts so you can be inspired by your choice.

JetBrains Mono

Without a doubt this is my favorite and it is the one I am currently using. It is free and opensource.

Download

Victor Mono

Download

Fira Code

This is also a good option since it is very well legible and its price is free too.

Download
